STATE OF MICHIGAN
DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES
GRETCHEN WHITMER
LANS ING
ELIZABETH HERTEL
GOVERNOR DIRECTOR
April 3, 2025
II Baker
JACKSON COUNTY YOUTH CENTER
930 FLEMING AVE,
JACKSON, MI, 49202-2534
Re: License #: CO380201204
Dear II Baker:
Attached is the Renewal Inspection Report for the above referenced agency completed
on March 28th, 2025. The renewal inspection has determined substantial compliance with
applicable licensing statutes and rules. Your license is renewed, and you will be receiving
the license in the mail. It is valid only at your present address and is nontransferable. If
you move, please notify us at least 30 days in advance.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager, Samantha Way at 517-243-9743.
Sincerely,
Brittany Cowans, Licensing Consultant
enclosure

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
The agency is in compliance with all applicable rules and statutes.
IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
The agency was offered technical assistance in the following areas:
• There was no technical assistance requested or required.
V. CONSULTATION
The agency was offered consultation in the following areas:
• There was no consultation requested or required.

VI. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
Maltreatment in Care
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this licensing
period.
Corrective Action Plan Compliance
The facility had one Corrective Action Plan approved during this reporting period
for SI2024SIC0001219. The first rule violation was regarding a youth’s
confinement, that visual observations of the youth will be made by staff at least
every 15 minutes and each contact will be logged at the time of the observation.
Action item included re-training of staff on proper documentation of room checks
and recording accurate time checks. The second rule violation was regarding
using a youth confinement room and the agency shall establish and follow written
policies and procedures specifying its use. Action item included that policy 1170 –
Isolation of a youth, was amended to clarify that staff should never open the door
to an isolated youth alone. All staff were required to sign acknowledgments of the
policy. The corrective action plan was successfully implemented in that the rule
was not a repeat violation during this reporting period.
Financial Overview
N/A
PREA compliance (if applicable)
N/A
Chief Administrator Assessment
N/A
Staff and Youth Interviews
Staff interviews were conducted during the inspection and no issues or concerns
were raised. Staff reported they felt supported by their direct supervisor and
administration team. Staff discussed how updated policies are communicated with
the team. All staff enjoy working at the facility.

Youth interviews were conducted during the inspection and no issues or concerns
were raised. The youth all understood the grievance procedure and felt staff take
this seriously. Each youth reported they enjoy the food at the facility.
Description of Agency Walk Through
An onsite inspection and walkthrough of the entire facility occurred on 3/18/2025.
There were no issues or safety concerns noted. The facility was well maintained,
clean, and well organized. All bedrooms in use had appropriate bedding. The
bathrooms were viewed to have running water, working toilets, working sinks and
working showers. The school classrooms and kitchen was also viewed and no
concerns noted.
VII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the agency is in compliance with all applicable licensing
statutes. It is recommended that the agency be issued a renewal of their regular
license.
